Title: Secure by Default: Building Confidence in AI-Driven Delivery
Abstract:
The fastest way to break trust in DevSecOps is to automate insecurity at scale. As AI takes a central role in our pipelines, it is time to rethink what "secure by default" really means.

In this keynote, Dewan Ahmed will challenge the audience to look beyond vulnerability scanners and compliance gates. He will share a vision for intelligent security by design, where native intelligence within the delivery platform detects not only vulnerable code but risky delivery behavior such as misconfigured environments, suspicious artifact provenance, and drift between source and runtime.

You will walk away with a framework for balancing automation with human oversight and examples from Harness’ work on building verifiable, auditable, AI-native delivery systems. In the new world of DevSecOps, safety is not a step; it is an outcome we continuously learn to improve.

Company1: Sikkim Manipal University of Health.Medical & Technological Sciences
Title: DevSecOps: AI-Driven Cloud Security Transforming Performance & Operations
Abstract: Transform your DevSecOps pipeline with AI that delivers 98.3% threat detection, 83.4% breach reduction, and 81.4% security downtime cuts. Real enterprise data reveals actionable strategies for immediate implementation and measurable ROI.

Title: AI-Driven Customer Experience: How to Start, Scale, and Succeed in the Enterprise
Abstract:
This session will highlight practical strategies for using AI to transform customer experience in the enterprise. Based on my work at Snowflake and supported by real-world outcomes, topics will include:

- Building hyper-personalized customer journeys using AI in industries like retail, finance, and healthcare
- Case study: Using AI to analyze CSAT feedback and dramatically improve response times and satisfaction
- Leveraging modern AI agents and chatbots for smarter, empathetic support
- Predictive analytics for proactive issue resolution across telecom, SaaS, and manufacturing
- Navigating ethical challenges, including data silos, bias, and over-personalization
- Five actionable best practices for effective AI adoption

The aim is to provide attendees with a practical blueprint for embedding AI into their workflows, balancing automation with the human touch, and driving measurable impact.

Title: How AI can enhance digital forensic analysis and evidence collection
Abstract: In a world where cybercriminals evolve faster, AI is revolutionizing digital forensics, uncovering evidence, helping investigations, and automating analysis. Discover how AI-driven forensics enhances accuracy, speeds up case resolution, and reshapes future cybersecurity investigations.

Title: AI-Driven DevSecOps: Redefining Quality, Security, and Speed with Generative AI & ML
Abstract: See how Generative AI and ML transform DevSecOps into an intelligent, adaptive practice. Learn how AI-driven testing, security, and defect prevention accelerate releases, reduce risks, and scale resilience in modern pipelines.

Title: DevSecOps for AI: Embedding Security and Ethics into the Machine Learning Pipeline
Abstract: Learn how to embed security, compliance, and ethics into your AI pipelines. This talk shows how DevSecOps teams can safeguard ML systems from design to deployment using secure data flows, privacy-aware training, policy-as-code, and audit-ready pipelines for trustworthy AI.

Title: Accelerating Enterprise Migrations with Secure and Scalable Automation
Abstract: Discover how automation is transforming complex enterprise migrations into faster, safer, and more predictable journeys. Learn how DevSecOps-driven frameworks reduce risks, close security gaps, and enable zero-downtime transitions turning migration into a true strategic advantage.

Title: From Blue to Green Without Seeing Red: Mastering Deployments on AWS
Abstract:
How can you implement a Blue/Green deployment strategy on AWS? What are the benefits — and the trade-offs? These are some of the questions this talk will answer through a real-world case study.

We’ll explore how Lambda@Edge can be used to meet this need for a web application delivered via CloudFront, and how to adapt this implementation when caching comes into play. Expect discussions around architecture, optimization, and performance.

This is a hands-on field experience, illustrated by the technical decisions made and the challenges encountered along the way.

Title: DevSecOps Revolution: AI-Powered Autonomous Cloud Security & Infrastructure
Abstract: Discover how AI/ML transforms DevSecOps from manual security gates to autonomous protection, enabling shift-left security with 40% fewer production vulnerabilities and 25% faster deployment cycles.

Title: Automation Unleashed: Securing and Scaling DevOps, SRE, and Platform Engineering for High-Velocity, Resilient Delivery
Abstract: Unlock the power of automation to secure, scale, and accelerate software delivery. Learn how DevOps, SRE, and Platform Engineering teams cut lead times by 80%, reduce MTTR by 70%, and achieve 99.99% uptime with resilience and speed.

Title: A/B Testing & Experimentation: A Practical Path to Data Science Career Growth
Abstract: Discover how A/B testing and experimentation can launch your data science career! Learn battle-tested techniques, real-world frameworks, and portfolio strategies that set you apart in a DevSecOps world where data-driven decisions mean everything.

Title: Lakehouse Architecture: Secure, Scalable Data Management for DevSecOps
Abstract: Unlock the power of Data Lakehouse Architecture! Discover how to unify security, scale, and real-time analytics to cut costs, streamline workflows, and drive DevSecOps success. Learn proven strategies to modernize data while staying secure and compliant.

Title: Secure Self-Service BI: Democratizing Data Access in the DevSecOps Era
Abstract: Unlock the power of secure self-service BI! Discover how AI, NLP, and augmented analytics can deliver rapid insights while embedding DevSecOps principles of governance, automation, and trust. Learn to democratize data without sacrificing security or compliance.

Title: Cloud-Native Databases: Adaptive Partitioning and Indexing for Performance and Security
Abstract: Discover how cloud-native partitioning, adaptive indexing, and ML-powered automation are redefining database performance, scalability, and security empowering DevSecOps teams to handle massive workloads with speed, resilience, and precision.

Title: AI for Inclusive Education: Secure and Ethical Personalization of Learning Pathways
Abstract: AI is reshaping education for 7.5M+ U.S. students with special needs. This session shows how DevSecOps safeguards data, ensures equity, and powers adaptive learning systems that improve outcomes while keeping trust and compliance at the core.

Title: DevSecOps Health Framework: 4-Dimension Assessment Cutting Incidents by 42%
Abstract: Learn how a 4-dimension Technical Health Index transforms reactive DevSecOps into proactive security optimization, delivering 42% fewer incidents and 2.8× faster secure development across 15 enterprise implementations. Get actionable metrics for your pipeline.

Title: DevSecOps Supply Chain Defense: Proactive Strategies Against Modern Cyber Threats
Abstract: Transform your DevSecOps pipeline security with proven strategies that reduce supply chain attacks by 57%. Learn actionable frameworks from real-world incidents to build resilient, proactive defense systems that protect your entire software delivery lifecycle.

Title: Supply Chain Defense by Default — SBOMs, SLSA, and Provenance in CI/CD
Abstract: Lock down your software supply chain without slowing delivery. Automate SBOMs, enforce provenance and attestations, adopt hermetic builds, and verify artifacts at deploy—so every release is traceable, trusted, and compliant by default.

Title: Sustainable Developer Productivity: Avoiding Pitfalls in DevSecOps Culture
Abstract: Discover how to overcome the “productivity paradox” in DevSecOps. Learn the top pitfalls draining developer effectiveness and a proven framework to boost secure delivery, reduce burnout, and build sustainable, high-performing engineering cultures.

Title: Securing Innovation at Scale: A DevSecOps Playbook for Safe Rollouts and Continuous Experimentation
Abstract: Learn how global SaaS leaders deliver rapid innovation without sacrificing trust. This talk reveals a DevSecOps playbook for secure rollouts, feature experimentation, and cross-team collaboration that empowers enterprises to innovate faster, safer, and at scale

Title: Building Unbreakable Systems: Risk-Driven DevSecOps in Action
Abstract: Systems fail when risk is overlooked. This talk shows how risk-driven DevSecOps — powered by automation, monitoring, and compliance-as-code — helps enterprises build resilient, “unbreakable” systems that adapt under pressure without slowing innovation.

Title: Banking-as-a-Service: Secure APIs and Compliance for Cloud-Native Financial Systems
Abstract: Discover how Banking-as-a-Service turns banks into secure, API-driven platforms. Learn how DevSecOps principles zero-trust, compliance automation, and observability enable fintechs and enterprises to build scalable, cloud-native financial services with confidence.

Title: Securing High-Frequency Trading at Scale: Event-Driven, Cloud-Native Order Management Systems
Abstract: Discover how to architect secure, event-driven trading systems that scale to millions of messages per second. Learn proven DevSecOps patterns, cloud-native strategies, and real-world case studies powering the future of high-frequency trading.

Title: Securing AI-Driven Financial Operations: RAG & Agentic Systems at Scale
Abstract: Learn to secure AI-driven financial systems at massive scale. Covers DevSecOps patterns for RAG/LLM pipelines, real-time threat detection, and compliance automation achieving 40% efficiency gains with bulletproof security.

Title: Ensemble Load Balancing in Cloud Banking: Secure, Scalable, and Reliable Transactions
Abstract: Discover how an Ensemble Cloud Load-Balancing Algorithm transforms digital banking by cutting response times, boosting throughput, and ensuring secure, scalable transactions. Learn how predictive analytics and adaptive strategies keep cloud systems resilient under real-world pressure.

Title: DevSecOps for GenAI in Finance: Building Secure & Ethical AI Systems
Abstract: Master DevSecOps for GenAI in finance. Learn security-by-design practices that helped prevent $20B+ fraud while automating compliance, bias detection, and ethical AI governance at scale.

Title: Supercharging DevOps with MCP (Without Opening a Security Hole)
Abstract: MCP lets LLMs trigger CI jobs, query Grafana, or debug from Sentry—right from your IDE. This talk shows how to build secure, powerful MCP workflows for DevOps, and what risks to watch as you plug LLMs into your stack without opening a security hole.

Title: DevSecOps Architecting Resilient Retail Supply Chains with Event-Driven
Abstract: Transform your retail architecture with DevSecOps-powered event-driven systems. Master securing Kafka at scale, zero-trust microservices, and compliance automation—all while achieving sub-millisecond performance in production retail workloads.

Title: AI Infrastructure over Ethernet: Secure, Scalable, High-Performance Design
Abstract: Discover how Ethernet is transforming AI infrastructure. From RoCEv2 to UEC-driven standards, learn how to build secure, scalable, and high-performance networks that rival InfiniBand empowering AI training, inference, and DevSecOps at scale.

Title: Resilience Engineering for Secure and Fault-Tolerant Enterprise Systems
Abstract: Learn how to build enterprise systems that stay secure, reliable, and fast no matter what breaks. Discover proven fault-tolerance patterns, chaos engineering tactics, and real-world DevSecOps strategies to prevent downtime, stop cascading failures, and keep your systems resilient at scale.

Title: Optimizing LLM Deployment with PagedAttention for Secure and Scalable AI
Abstract: Unlock the future of AI deployment! Discover how PagedAttention and cutting-edge optimizations supercharge LLM performance while reducing costs and risks. Learn how DevSecOps teams can scale models securely and efficiently turning infrastructure challenges into competitive advantage.

Title: Agentic AI for DevSecOps: Autonomous, Resilient, and Scalable Operations
Abstract: Discover how Agentic AI is redefining DevSecOps by enabling autonomous, resilient, and scalable operations. Learn how intelligent agents detect issues, resolve risks, and optimize workflows—freeing teams to focus on innovation while building secure, future-ready systems.

Title: Securing Enterprise AI: Governance, Risk, and Economics of LLM Adoption
Abstract: Most enterprise AI projects fail before production. This talk reveals how DevSecOps leaders can secure, govern, and scale LLM adoption with a proven framework balancing cost, compliance, and performance for sustainable enterprise AI success.

Title: End-to-End Security with DevSecOps: From Code to Cloud
Abstract: Discover how to embed security seamlessly into your DevOps pipeline in End-to-End Security with DevSecOps: From Code to Cloud. Learn practical strategies for integrating tools, automating checks, and building scalable, secure pipelines across Azure and AWS—empowering teams to deliver with confidence

Title: Breach preparation. When it's all going south, what should you wish that you had done yesterday?
Abstract: The best response isn’t necessarily the fastest.  We walk you through 5 steps that will minimise damage and improve your chances of getting back to BAU in a timely way.

Title: Understanding SAST Foundations with Open-Source Semgrep
Abstract:
Static Application Security Testing (SAST) is a fundamental practice for securing the software development lifecycle, but its inner workings are often treated as a complex black box. This session peels back those layers, focusing on the core principles of static analysis using the fast, open-source Semgrep engine as our practical guide. We will explore how modern SAST moves beyond simple text searching by parsing code into Abstract Syntax Trees (ASTs) to understand its true structure and intent.

On that foundation, we will start with Semgrep (semgrep.dev), a fast, open-source SAST engine that matches code shapes across many languages. You’ll learn Semgrep’s minimal building blocks: YAML rules, patterns, and pattern combinators, metavariables and constraints, severity and metadata, and autofix for developer-friendly guidance. We’ll also cover when to switch from simple structural matching to taint mode (sources, sinks, sanitizers) for data-flow findings. Finally, we outline the basics of adopting Semgrep, including running it locally and in CI, as well as starting with community rule packs and testing rules.

Attendees leave with a clear mental model of how SAST works and a practical, open-source starting point to add precise, maintainable code checks to their DevSecOps workflows.

JobTitle1: Business Program Manager - Lead Technical Trainer
Title: A lap around GitHub Dependabot, CodeQL and other built-in security features
Abstract: Like any other development process, security should be at the forefront of the dev cycle. That's where GitHub provides built-in solutions with Dependabot, CodeQL and several others. Learn in this session how to enable security features to protect code from vulnerabilities, full demos, no slides...

Title: Securing Payment Gateway Evolution: DevSecOps in Microservices Migration
Abstract: Learn how payment gateways achieve rapid, secure deployments through DevSecOps practices, reducing security incidents 60% while maintaining PCI compliance and enabling daily releases in microservices architectures.

Title: Securing Healthcare at Scale: DevSecOps for Critical Patient Platforms
Abstract: I built a HIPAA-compliant mobile platform serving 450+ cancer patients across 12 centers. Learn my DevSecOps approach: zero-trust architecture, compliance automation, and secure CI/CD that achieved 92% completion rates.

Title: The Evolution of Infrastructure Management: From GitOps to Intelligent DevSecOps with AIOps
Abstract: What does AIOps mean in the context of infrastructure management?  Is it just lipstick on a pig? Is it putting a bot in charge of my datacenter?  Lessons from re-envisioning what it means to be a DevOps tool and platform and evolve into something truly useful to automate and secure at scale.
